member.name: F:CAS.AdError.NotReady
member.summary: Ad are not ready to show. You need to call Load ads or use one of the automatic cache mode. If you are already using automatic cache mode then just wait a little longer.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.Timeout
member.summary: The Timeout error occurs when an advertising source fails to respond within a specified timeframe. Following this error, the system continues to await a response from the source, potentially resulting in delayed ad loading or triggering a genuine loading error.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.NoFill
member.summary:
This means we are not able to serve ads to this person.
Note that if you can see ads while you are testing with enabled , your implementation works correctly and people will be able to see ads in your app once it's live.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.ReachedCap
member.summary:
Ad creative has reached its daily cap for user.
The reason is for cross promo only.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.NotInitialized
member.summary: The CAS is not initialized at the moment.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.NoConnection
member.summary: Loading ads cannot be successful without an internet connection.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.Configuration
member.summary: A configuration error has been detected in one of the mediation ad sources. Please report error message to your manager support.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.NotPassedInterval
member.summary:
The interval between impressions of Interstitial Ad has not yet passed.
To change the interval, use property.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.AlreadyDisplayed
member.summary:
You can not show ads because another fullscreen ad is being displayed at the moment.
Please check your ad call logic to eliminate duplicate impressions.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.NotForeground
member.summary: Ads cannot be shown as the application is currently not visible to the user.

member.name: F:CAS.AdError.ManagerIsDisabled
member.summary:
The ad format you want to use is not active at the moment.
To change the state of the manager, use method.

member.summary: The mediated network’s name that purchased the impression.

member.name: P:CAS.AdMetaData.revenue
member.summary:
The revenue generated for the impression (USD).
The revenue value is either estimated or exact, according to the property.

member.name: P:CAS.AdMetaData.cpm
member.summary:
The Cost Per Mille estimated impressions of the ad in USD.
The same value as multiplied by 1000.

member.name: P:CAS.AdMetaData.priceAccuracy
member.summary: Accuracy of the revenue value.

member.name: P:CAS.AdMetaData.creativeIdentifier
member.summary: The creative id tied to the ad, if any. May be null. You can report creative issues to our Ad review team using this id.

member.name: P:CAS.AdMetaData.identifier
member.summary: Internal demand source name in CAS database.

member.name: P:CAS.AdMetaData.impressionDepth
member.summary: The amount of impressions of all ad formats to the current user for all sessions.

member.name: P:CAS.AdMetaData.lifetimeRevenue
member.summary: The total revenue in USD from impressions of all ad formats to the current user for all sessions.

member.name: T:CAS.AdPosition
member.summary: Ad Position on screen. ___Left____Center____Right__ Top | 1 | 0 | 2 | Middle | 7 | 6 | 8 | Bottom | 4 | 3 | 5 |

member.name: F:CAS.AdPosition.Undefined
member.summary: Service value to continue use previously Ad Position.

member.name: F:CAS.AdSize.Banner
member.summary: Standard banner size 320dp width and 50dp height

member.name: F:CAS.AdSize.AdaptiveBanner
member.summary:
Pick Adaptive AdSize for screen width but not more than 728dp.
Pick the best ad size, adaptive banners use fixed aspect ratios instead of fixed heights.
The height of adaptive banners cannot be less than 50 dp and more than 250 dp.
This results in banner ads that occupy a more consistent portion of the screen across devices and provide opportunities for improved performance.
For full width banners, you can use the .

member.name: F:CAS.AdSize.SmartBanner
member.summary: Typically, Smart Banners on phones have a size. Or on tablets a size.

member.name: F:CAS.AdSize.Leaderboard
member.summary: Leaderboard banner size 728dp width and 90dp height

member.name: F:CAS.AdSize.MediumRectangle
member.summary: Medium Rectangle size 300dp width and 250dp height

member.name: F:CAS.AdSize.AdaptiveFullWidth
member.summary:
Pick Adaptive AdSize for full screen width.
Pick the best ad size, adaptive banners use fixed aspect ratios instead of fixed heights.
The height of adaptive banners cannot be less than 50 dp and more than 250 dp.
This results in banner ads that occupy a more consistent portion of the screen across devices and provide opportunities for improved performance.

member.name: F:CAS.AdSize.ThinBanner
member.summary:
Thin banners have a smaller height, taller banners compared to anchored adaptive banners. The thin banner uses the full available screen width.
Pick the best ad size in full width of screen and height 32-50 for Landscape and 50-90 for Portrait orientations.
The height of thin banners can be 32 dp for landscape orientation.

member.name: F:CAS.Audience.Mixed
member.summary:
The user's age has not been determined.
If your app's target age groups include both children and older audiences, any ads that may be shown to children must comply with Google Play's Families Ads Program. A neutral age screen must be implemented so that any ads not suitable for children are only shown to older audiences. A neutral age screen is a mechanism to verify a user's age in a way that doesn't encourage them to falsify their age and gain access to areas of your app that aren't designed for children, for example, an age gate.
You could change the audience at runtime after determining the user's age.

member.name: F:CAS.Audience.Children
F:CAS.Audience.NotChildren
member.summary: Audiences over the age of 13 NOT subject to the restrictions of child protection laws.

member.summary:
Ad filters by Audience
By default selected in `Assets/CleverAdsSolutions/Settings` menu

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.userConsent
member.summary:
GDPR user Consent SDK Implementation for ads on session.
Default:

member.name: M:CAS.IAdsSettings.GetVendorConsent(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Parses the system preferences string with key `IABTCF_VendorConsents` to determine the consent status of the IAB vendor with the provided ID.
TCF Vendor List
member.param: Vendor ID as defined in the Global Vendor List.
member.returns: Accepted if the advertising entity has consent, Denied if not, or Undefined if VendorConsents is not available on disk.

member.name: M:CAS.IAdsSettings.GetAdditionalConsent(System.Int32)
member.summary:
Parses the system preferences string with key `IABTCF_AddtlConsent` to determine the consent status of the advertising entity with the provided Ad Technology Provider (ATP) ID.
Google’s Additional Consent Mode technical specification
List of Google ATPs and their IDs
member.param: Vendor ID as defined in the Global Vendor List.
member.returns: Accepted if the advertising entity has consent, Denied if not, or Undefined if AddtlConsent is not available on disk.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.userCCPAStatus
member.summary:
Whether or not user has opted out of the sale of their personal information.
Default:

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.trialAdFreeInterval
member.summary:
Defines the time interval, in seconds, starting from the moment of the initial app installation, during which users can use the application without ads being displayed while still retaining access to the Rewarded Ads format.
Within this interval, users enjoy privileged access to the application's features without intrusive advertisements.
0 seconds by default.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.bannerRefreshInterval
member.summary:
An ad unit’s automatic refresh rate (in seconds) determines how often a new ad request is generated for that ad unit.
Ad requests should not be made when the device screen is turned off.
We recomended using refresh rate 30 seconds.
However, you can choose any value you want longer than 10 seconds.
30 seconds by default.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.interstitialInterval
member.summary:
You can limit the posting of an interstitial ad to a period of time in seconds after the ad is closed, during which display attempts will fail.
Default: 0 seconds.
Note that the interval starts only after the Interstitial Ad closes .
If you need to wait for a period of time after the start of the game or after showing a Rewarded Ad until next Interstitial Ad impression then please call the following method:

member.name: M:CAS.IAdsSettings.RestartInterstitialInterval
member.summary:
Restart interval until next Interstitial ad display.
By default, the interval before first Interstitial Ad impression is ignored.
You can use this method to delay displaying ad.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.isMutedAdSounds
member.summary:
Sounds in ads mute state
Disabled by default.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.allowInterstitialAdsWhenVideoCostAreLower
member.summary:
This option will compare ad cost and serve regular interstitial ads when rewarded video ads are expected to generate less revenue.
Interstitial Ads does not require to watch the video to the end, but the callback will be triggered in any case.
By default selected in `Assets/CleverAdsSolutions/Settings` menu

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.isDebugMode
member.summary:
The enabled Debug Mode will display a lot of useful information for debugging about the states of the sdc with tag `CAS`.
Disabling Debug Mode may improve application performance. Disabled by default.

member.name: M:CAS.IAdsSettings.SetTestDeviceIds(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary:
Identifiers corresponding to test devices which will always request test ads. List of test devices should be defined before first MediationManager initialized.
1. Run an app configured with the CAS SDK.
2. Check the console or logcat output for a message that looks like this: "To get test ads on this device, set ... "
3. Copy your alphanumeric test device ID to your clipboard.
4. Add the test device ID to the list.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.loadingMode
member.summary:
CAS mediation processing mode of ad requests.
By default selected in `Assets/CleverAdsSolutions/Settings` menu

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.isExecuteEventsOnUnityThread
member.summary:
Required for Android runtime only. Enabled by default. Advertising events for the Android runtime are queued to be called during the next `Update()` cycle. This behavior is safe for using UnityEngine components in advertising events. However, because Unity does not call `Update` while displaying fullscreen ads, all ad events will only be triggered after closing the fullscreen ad and returning to the Unity game.
If you want to receive callbacks from the ad without waiting for the ad to close, you can disable the following property in the settings. You will also need to use `CAS.EventExecutor.Add(Action)` to access Unity Engine components, where Action will be executed during the next `Update()` cycle.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.iOSAppPauseOnBackground
member.summary:
Indicates if the Unity app should be paused when a full screen ad (interstitial or rewarded video ad) is displayed.
Enabled by default.

member.name: P:CAS.IAdsSettings.trackLocationEnabled
member.summary:
The SDK automatically collects location data if the user allowed the app to track the location.
By default selected in `Assets/CleverAdsSolutions/Settings` menu

The coordinates on the screen are determined in pixels.

member.summary:
Manual load the Ad or reload current loaded Ad to skip impression.

member.name: M:CAS.IAdView.SetActive(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Activate or deactivate the AdView
If the AdView is active, it is displayed on the screen and user can interact with it.
When you need to hide AdView from the user, just deactivate it.

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.Build
member.summary:
Initialize new and save to CAS.MobileAds.manager field. Can be called for different identifiers to create different managers.
Attention! Do not initialize mediated advertising SDKs (CAS does that for you). Not following this step will result in noticeable integration issues.
member.exception: Not supported platform. Allowed Android, iOS and Editor only

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithCASId(System.Int32)
member.summary:
An CAS manager ID is a unique ID number assigned to each of your ad placements when they're created in CAS.
Using Manager Id at Index from list `Assets/CleverAdsSolutions/Settings` menu.
Index 0 by default when the method is not called.
member.exception: CAS ID are not found with index

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithCASId(System.String)
member.summary:
An CAS manager ID is a unique ID number assigned to each of your ad placements when they're created in CAS.
Typically, Manager ID for Adnroid equals the App Bundle ID, and for iOS the iTunes ID.
The manager ID is added to your app's code and used to identify ad requests.
Attention The identifier is different for each platforms. You need to define different identifiers depending on the current platform.
You can use a generic way to get the ID by ordinal index for current platform.
Please set all used Manager IDs in `Assets > CleverAdsSolutions > Settings` menu to setup the project correctly.

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithCompletionListener(CAS.CASInitCompleteEvent)
member.summary: Set listener to receive a callback after all CAS initialization processes have completed.

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithEnabledAdTypes(CAS.AdFlags[])
member.summary:
An Enabled Ad types is option to increase application performance by initializing only those ad types that will be used.
.withEnabledAdTypes(AdFlags.Banner, AdFlags.Interstitial)
Changes in current session only.
Ad types can be enabled manually after initialize by

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithUserID(System.String)
member.summary: The userID is a unique identifier supplied by your application and must be static for each user across sessions. Your userID should not contain any personally identifiable information such as an email address, screen name, Android ID(AID), or Google Advertising ID(GAID).

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithConsentFlow(CAS.ConsentFlow)
member.summary:
Create and attach the Conset flow configuration for initialization.
.withConsentFlow( new ConsentFlow() .withPrivacyPolicy("https://url_to_privacy_policy") )
CAS consent flow is enabled by default. You can disable the consent flow by building Ad Manager:
.withConsentFlow(new ConsentFlow(isEnabled: false))

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithMediationExtras(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Additional mediation settings. Use constant key from with values of "1" or "0".

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.ClearMediationExtras
member.summary: Clear additional mediation settings.

member.name: M:CAS.IManagerBuilder.WithTestAdMode(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Option to enable Test ad mode that will always request test ads.
If you're just looking to experiment with the SDK in a Hello World app, though, you can use the true with any manager ID string.
Don't forget to set False test ad mode to release application.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.LoadAd(CAS.AdType)
member.summary:
Loads an ad of the specified .
Before calling when is in use, you must call this method to load the ad.
To receive a callback when the ad is successfully loaded, subscribe to the OnLoadedAd events.
For loading banner ads, use obtained from .
member.param: The type of ad to load.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.IsReadyAd(CAS.AdType)
member.summary:
Checks whether the specified ad is ready to be shown.
To get detailed information about why an ad may not be shown, subscribe to the OnAdFailedToShow event instead of relying solely on this method. This event provides insights into errors that may prevent the ad from being displayed.
For checking if a banner ad is ready, use the property from .
member.param: The type of ad to check.
member.returns: True if the ad is ready to be shown; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.ShowAd(CAS.AdType)
member.summary:
Shows an ad of the specified .
To show a banner ad, use the method obtained from .
member.param: The type of ad to show.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.DisposeAd(CAS.AdType)
member.summary:
Disposes of the ad of the specified .
After calling this method, if you want to resume showing ads, you must call the method to reload the ad. Note that in automatic loading mode, ads will not be automatically reloaded after Dispose. You need to explicitly call to prepare the ad for future displays.
For disposing of a banner ad, use the method obtained from .
member.param: The type of ad to dispose.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.GetAdView(CAS.AdSize)
member.summary:
Retrieves the ad view interface for the specified .
If an ad view of the specified size already exists, a reference to the existing view will be returned instead of creating a new one.
Note that the returned is initially inactive. To display the ad, you need to activate the view by calling .
When the ad view is no longer needed, call to release the associated resources and free up memory.
After disposing of the ad view, you can use this method again to create a new view if needed.
member.param: The desired size of the ad view.
member.returns: The ad view interface for the specified size.

member.name: E:CAS.IMediationManager.OnAppReturnAdShown

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.SetAppReturnAdsEnabled(System.Boolean)
member.summary:
The Return Ad which is displayed once the user returns to your application after a certain period of time.
To minimize the intrusiveness, short time periods are ignored.
Return ads are disabled by default.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.SkipNextAppReturnAds
member.summary:
Calling this method will indicate to skip one next ad impression when returning to the app.
You can call this method when you intentionally redirect the user to another application (for example Google Play) and do not want them to see ads when they return to your application.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.SetEnableAd(CAS.AdType,System.Boolean)
member.summary:
Set enabled to processing.
If processing is inactive then all calls to the selected ad type will fail with error .
The state will not be saved between sessions.

member.name: M:CAS.IMediationManager.IsEnabledAd(CAS.AdType)
member.summary: Check enabled is processing. Read more about .

member.name: P:CAS.IMediationManager.lastPageAdContent
member.summary:
The latest free ad page for your own promotion.
This ad page will be displayed when there is no paid ad to show or internet availability.
By default, this page will not be displayed while the ad content is NULL.
**Attention!** Impressions and clicks on this ad page don't make money.

member.name: F:CAS.InitializationError.NoConnection

member.name: F:CAS.InitializationError.NotRegisteredID
member.summary: Indicates that the CAS ID is not registered in system. Contact support to clarify the reasons.

member.name: F:CAS.InitializationError.VerificationFailed

member.name: F:CAS.InitializationError.ServerError

member.name: P:CAS.ITargetingOptions.gender
member.summary: The user’s gender

member.name: P:CAS.ITargetingOptions.age
member.summary:
The user’s age
Limitation: 1-99 and 0 is 'unknown'

member.name: P:CAS.ITargetingOptions.locationCollectionEnabled
member.summary:
Collect from the device the latitude and longitude coordinated truncated to the hundredths decimal place.
Collect only if your application already has the relevant end-user permissions.
Does not collect if the target audience is children.
By default selected in `Assets/CleverAdsSolutions/Settings` menu

member.name: P:CAS.ITargetingOptions.contentURL
member.summary:
Sets the content URL for a web site whose content matches the app's primary content. This web site content is used for targeting and brand safety purposes.
Limitation: max URL length 512

member.name: M:CAS.ITargetingOptions.SetKeywords(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: A list of keywords, interests, or intents related to your application. Words or phrase describing the current activity of the user for targeting purposes.

member.name: M:CAS.LastPageAdContent.#ctor(System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String,System.String)
member.summary:
The latest free ad page for your own promotion. This ad page will be displayed when there is no paid ad to show or internet availability.
Apply this content to
member.param: Enter the message that you want users to see.
Enter a description for the app being promoted. Optional property.
Enter the URL that CAS will direct users to when they click the ad. This URL is not visible in the ad.
Enter the direct URL of the image to be used as the ad file. Optional property.
Enter the direct URL of the icon or logo (Small square picture). Optional property.

member.name: F:CAS.LoadingManagerMode.FastestRequests
member.summary:
Automatic control loading mediation ads.
Provides frequent polling of mediation networks for advertising content.
May increase coverage with more expensive ads.
But this will run more background processes that slow down the application.

member.name: F:CAS.LoadingManagerMode.FastRequests
member.summary:
Automatic control loading mediation ads.
Provides frequent polling of mediation networks for advertising content.
May increase coverage with more expensive ads.
But this will run more background processes that slow down the application.

member.name: F:CAS.LoadingManagerMode.Optimal
member.summary:
Automatic control loading mediation ads.
Provides balanced polling rate of mediation networks for advertising content.
Doesn't significantly affect application performance.

member.name: F:CAS.LoadingManagerMode.HighePerformance
member.summary:
Automatic control loading mediation ads.
Provides slow polling of mediation networks for advertising content.
This helps to reduce the impact of background processes on the application.
At the same time, do not lose much of the relevance of the high cost of advertising content.
Reduces memory reservations for advertising content.

member.name: F:CAS.LoadingManagerMode.HighestPerformance
member.summary:
Automatic control loading mediation ads.
Provides slow polling of mediation networks for advertising content.
This helps to reduce the impact of background processes on the application.
At the same time, do not lose much of the relevance of the high cost of advertising content.
Reduces memory reservations for advertising content.

member.name: F:CAS.LoadingManagerMode.Manual
member.summary:
Manual control loading mediation ads.
Provides minimal impact on application performance.
But it requires manual preparation of advertising content for display.
Use ad loading methods before trying to show:
Reduces memory reservations for advertising content.

member.name: F:CAS.PriceAccuracy.Floor
member.summary: The estimated revenue, can also be a minimum price (floor) for ad impression.

member.name: F:CAS.PriceAccuracy.Bid
member.summary: The revenue provided as part of the real-time auction.

member.name: F:CAS.PriceAccuracy.Undisclosed
member.summary: The revenue is '0', when the demand source does not agree to disclose the payout of impression.

member.name: T:CAS.EventExecutor
member.summary: Callbacks from CleverAdsSolutions are not guaranteed to be called on Unity thread. You can use EventExecutor to schedule each calls on the next Update() loop

member.name: M:CAS.EventExecutor.Initialize
member.summary: Creation of the Executor component if needed.

member.name: M:CAS.EventExecutor.IsActive
member.summary: Is initialized already.

member.name: M:CAS.EventExecutor.Add(System.Action)
member.summary:
Schedule action on the next Update() loop in Unity Thread.
Warning! To enable EventExecutor requires call once static method.

member.name: F:CAS.MediationExtras.facebookAdvertiserTracking
member.summary:
Advertising Tracking Enabled for Audience Network for iOS Only.
Set the `FBAdSettings.setAdvertiserTrackingEnabled` flag.
Value "1" flag to inform Audience Network to use the data to deliver personalized ads in line with your own legal obligations, platform terms, and commitments you’ve made to your users
Value "0" flag to inform Audience Network to not be able to deliver personalized ads.

member.name: F:CAS.MediationExtras.facebookDataProcessing
member.summary:
Facebook Data Processing Options for Users in California
Set the `FBAdSettings.setDataProcessingOptions` flag.
Values:
- "" - To explicitly not enable Limited Data Use (LDU) mode
- "LDU" - To enable LDU mode using geolocation
- "LDU_1_1000" - To enable LDU for users and specify user geography
For information about how to implement Facebook’s Limited Data Use flag in California, visit Facebook’s developer documentation.
